mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: Oldman and Seyfried prove to be the big attractions, but Hardwicke's Riding Hood legend still lacks bite.
Catherine Hardwicke's prettified movie is a strange adaptation because it supplants the woodsy horror of the original fairy tale with two new elements: a romantic triangle and a witch hunt.
The best that can be said is that the production design is striking. Otherwise, it's a foolish story, marred by a strange blend of overacting and bland, offhand performances.
Seyfried's a good actress, but all the art direction in the world can't make this version of events the stuff either of dreams or of nightmares.
My, what sharp teeth Ms. Hardwicke doesn't have: working from David Leslie Johnson's screenplay she takes on the story's grown-up themes of sex and death directly but weakly.
Gorgeously shot, smartly conceived, cleverly cast, badly executed - the lush medieval beauty here is at best only skin deep.
Seyfried holds the camera's attention, playing this storybook business pretty much straight, although David Leslie Johnson's script puts the actress sorely to the test.
At least the werewolves in Red Riding Hood have teeth and, when in human form, they don't parade around shirtless.
Oldman makes a four-course dinner out of the scenery with enough slash and burn to leave you wondering if he is vying with Nicolas Cage for the title of filmdom's biggest hambone.

The main difference is that while the "Twilight" films strive for straight-faced grimness, Red Riding Hood often verges on outright florid hilarity. It isn't laughing at itself, but that needn't stop the audience.
It's strange and stupid and half-compelling and sometimes beautiful.
The highlight, though, is Julie Christie as Grandma, whose GILFy gorgeousness (especially in the "better to eat you with" scene) is the only thing in this overblown campfest with real teeth.
Intermittently enjoyable hokum at best.
Hardwicke shows a strong grasp at epic fantasy with Red Riding Hood; her nemesis is not a man-eating wolf but an unsurprising script.
There is a sort of unintentional campy fun to be had in places. Just don't go in expecting much, in other words, and perhaps you'll live happily ever after.
With its stilted dialogue, fragments of voice-over and over-busy camera, Red Riding Hood feels off-kilter from the start.
Such a sorrowful attempt to resurrect the marketing magic of "Twilight" that it ought to be titled "Career Eclipse."
A laughably inept series of adolescent poses trying to pass itself off as a movie.
Far more grim than "Grimm," and not nearly as much fun as it should have been.
Aside from a few arresting visuals, Red Riding Hood is just a slog through the woods.
Red Riding Hood goes from trite to triter, a plot collapse that overtakes any of the visual prettiness from cinematographer Mandy Walker (Beastly).

Like an idiot, I came to this movie hoping that director Catherine Hardwicke-who made her debut with the bad-girl shocker "Thirteen" (2003)-might engage in a feminist interrogation of the old fairy tale, just as French filmmaker Catherine Breillat has with "Blue Beard" (2009) and "The Sleeping Beauty" (2010). Instead this is a muddle-headed horror flick.
As it thuds along from one wolf attack to the next, Catherine Hardwicke's first film since taking leave of Bella and her toothy friends adamantly refuses to provide any wit, humor or fun.
RRH veers between monotonous, soapy seriousness and camp.
Ugly, dull, bloodless, dumb, and phony to its core.

I have no idea how to blow up a two-page fairy tale into 100 minutes of blockbuster, but frankly I was hoping for more backstory about the titular cape in Red Riding Hood. Thread count? Machine washability?
Has the added inconvenience of being dreadfully serious about a plot so preposterous, it demands to be filmed by Monty Python.

Even wild man Gary Oldman, as a priest ready to eighty-six the wolfman with silver nail polish, can't liven up this humorless hogwash. And it's just sad to see the legendary Julie Christie stuck playing the grandmother.
A lurid, loopy, utterly ludicrous enterprise.
According to legend, a silver bullet can kill a werewolf. Too bad it can't slay bad writing, without which the ill-conceived Red Riding Hood would not exist.
A timid new take on the old fairy tale, and it's pretty grim.
This Red Riding Hood loses sight of the forest for the trees on its way to Grandma's house.

The amazingly awful dramatic thriller Red Riding Hood could, with tweaks, be enjoyably bad in a "Plan 9 From Outer Space" kind of way. Instead, it's M. Night Shyamalan-style bad, which means despite all the unintentional snickers, you feel trapped.
Was Red Riding Hood masterminded by a cadre of particularly silly 11-year-olds undergoing withdrawal from Twilight? That's the only excuse for a movie this dopey.

This tedious retelling of the venerable fairy tale-"Twilight" with Oedipal kinks-takes place in a medieval village that is plagued by a werewolf, and that looks like a shtetl settled by California actors.

mc_user_reviews.text: One of the best films I've ever seen, extremely underrated, Amanda's performance is incredible. And the mix of romance, suspense and a touch of goth in the scenery is breathtaking. Worth seeing, especially the scenes with Amanda walking through the forest red hood.

So, I'm gonna be frank over here. I don't really understand where all the bad reviews come, if it makes such an improvement in Catherine Hardwicke's previous disgusting directing. I really saw an improvement here, from the mother of the worst, Twilight. I liked Red Riding Hood really much because it is quite interesting and unpredictable, but werewolves are monsters, not normal animals ms. Hardwicke, you should've worked on that and I could give it the 8 it could deserve (not saying the movie is bad) If they make a sequel, which I really doubt, I'm gonna be one to see it.
I can't say that it is the best movie I ever watched but it is very interesting film and i like this film ! It is show something new to us and I think it maybe better than twilnight !

I'm one of those people that finds a way to like if not love 9 out of 10 movies.  That said, RRH is that 1 out of 10:  the Stinker...just a weird and stilted film that never finds its footing.  One of the funkier things about the movie is that it has the trappings of a period piece where you expect the characters to have at least a little bit of British accent, but they all end up talking like your standard modern American (with the exception of Gary Oldman who overacts--or maybe it just seems likes he overacts b/c the other actors barely are acting).  Visual, Design and Costumes were cool... especially RRH's deep red Hood/Cape contrasting with the cool colors.  Bottom Line:  Amanda Seyfried's beauty saves the movie from being a zero.

Worst movie i had seen since "The Fog".  The lead had absolutely no chemistry with her counter parts.  The dialog was horrible, the screen shots were jagged, the celebration reminded me of a village full of inbreed villagers set in Mardi Gras.  The villians were laughable as villians... the cruelty was over the top & seemed faked. The best part of the movie was when Gary Oldman died (I guess everyone is facing hard times in this economy)... as his character gave me a headache.

I found the acting overall to be very well done, with the single exception of Gary Oldman who was never plausible in that particular role. The cinematography was at times stunning but the script seemed a little too contrived to hold up well. All of that being said I saw it a second time with my Twihard Tween who absolutely adored it from beginning to end.

If you are a teenage girl that thinks the Twilight series is art and the best thing ever, or that the Justin Biber movie was great, then  you may like this film.  Otherwise, it is a steaming pile of werewolf poo.  What a waste of time, with bad acting and bad CGI effects.

Amanda Seyfried is, visually, perfectly cast as Red Riding Hood... and was the best acting in the film.  I don't know what Gary Oldman was thinking when he took on this project.  Did he lose a bet?  Either way, Grandma, what lame acting!  I found myself rooting for the big bad werewolf... and wondering why, despite living in a snowy mountain village, no one ever wore a coat.

i enjoyed the film in the beginning, it had the nice mystery on who the wolf is and they mixed it up to where several people could be the wolf. However i started to dislike the movie when i discovered that you couldn't really see the wolf kill anyone and how she could understand what the wolf was saying. Amanda Seyfried is a fantastic actress and i always give her 5 stars for her acting, but the movies that she plays in just arn't the best movies.

I just got back from the theater, and I can tell you that I really enjoyed it. Not the best movie, but a good one. I really didn't know what to expect because of the critics, but I have learned not to listen what other people say but to see it with my own eyes and then, talk about it. And to be honest, I walked into the theater a little bit nervous about what am I going to see, does it really suck so bad? But walked out with a smile. Everyone's got their own opinion, the critics say it is so bad, I say it's good. If your looking for a cliched love story, a little bit of suspense and, well, Amanda Seyfried, then this movie is for you.
I like it.

From the maker of "Thirteen", the 2003 film that depicts the accelerated speed in which kids are growing up in today's society, now comes "Red Riding Hood", the latest retelling of the ancient faerie tale made famous by The Brothers Grimm(known as "Rottkappchen") that shows how young medieval wenches from yore were no chaste angels either. Billed as a reworking of the popular "Twilight Saga", the film's theme of a young girl's lost innocence aligns itself equally well with the Larry Clark-lite indie, since in the recent "Eclipse", Bella(Kristen Stewart) keeps her virginity, whereas Valerie(Amanda Seyfried) gives it away quite freely for a nineteenth century chick. Starring Evan Rachel Wood and Holly Hunter, "Thirteen" examines the ramifications of a mother who tries too hard to be her daughter's contemporary. In one scene, set at a high-end Melrose clothing boutique, Tracey emerges from the changing room outfitted in garb more suitable for a bar than middle school. Most mothers would throw a fit, but Melanie, a former flower child, wanting to be "the hot big sister" that Evie(Nikki Reed) labels her as, endorses the tight-fitting ensemble by remarking, "You look incredible." In effect, encouraging her little girl to flaunt her wares around boys through coquettish behavior. Similarly, in "Red Riding Hood", Valerie, who had previously looked as if she were a Renaissance fair fashion victim, accepts the scintillating red cloak from her proto-hippie grandmother(Julie Christie), who all but encourages the young lass to dress provocatively and to engage in sexual activities by warning the newly-ordained Red Riding Hood to be "careful". She makes for an equally poor role model as Valerie's mother, who gave birth to a love child, her half-sister Lucy. Betrothed to a wealthy blacksmith, Valerie still possesses some unresolved feelings towards a lowly woodcutter, who should have been the original wolf instead of a red herring, since the final plot twist creates some unintended sexual tension among family members.  The red cloak, originally intended as a wedding present to be worn on the night she was supposed to consummate her nuptials with Henry(Max Irons), the sexually-charged garment instead is utilized as a means to seduce Peter(Shiloh Fernandez) in a premarital fling, thereby spoiling the girl's chances for gainful holy matrimony. Valerie ends up living in the forest as an outcast, cohabitating with an animal outside the sanctity of marriage.

The movie was good. I expected better, but movies these days are not that good. I would say it is borderline worth the price of a ticket. If you have the money, then sure. If you are trying to save, don't see this in the theatre. I am glad I say it, but was hoping for it to be better. It is not scary, and has cheesy parts trying to be creepy. But the story is strong, and the watcher understands where they are going with it in the movie.
LÃ¡stima que tenga casi el mismo estilo de CrepÃºsculo, pero la pelÃ­cula me gustÃ³ harto.

You should watch it and expect to like it because of its premise Who is the Wolf but really besides Amanda Seyfried's amazing a just hot performance it is a waste of time and ends up being completely stupid. I give this movie 14%.

The real title of this movie should be "The Twilight Saga continues: Red Riding Hood".  The movie is blandly filmed as independent feature with a few epic shots here an there. By here and there I mean, the beginning and end of movie.  Less than talented acting cast, a storyline where the director says to himself  " it doesn't matter if it's confusing, let's focus on the cheap love triangle".  Poor graphics. The guessing game of "whose the wolf" is marvellously praised. However, it falls flat as a movie that makes up it's story along the way.

This movie has very little to go on; It's not scary, or funny, and it has a plot that is forgettable. The characters were unimaginative; the story was fallible. There are other, better movies to be watched.

Why? Oh, why they have to make movies like this? I was hopping to see a Red Rinding Hood story filled with horror and  slaughter of villagers.. and what did I get? A love triangle and stupid plot although Grandma was kind of creepy.  The best thing about this movie is that it was pretty funny.  Maybe the scene where Red is talking with the Wolf telepathically would be nominated for MTV 's Best WTF? moment. As lame the movie is I can find one thing that is pretty usual in all Medieval times villages: there is Always an Idiot.

This movie was okay. It was boring at the beg but then it pick up in the middle. The first 30 minutes of the movie is so boring. This movie is more like a twilight than a horror movie.  I like that they made red riding hood older. You would think since Red Riding Hood is older that this movie will be for older people. You wrong. Still the same type of movie as twilight. More romance than horror. I thought this movie was going be a horror film. THis movie has the same type of music that a twilight movie would have. Im kind of a twilight fan. I like twilight way more than this movie. I think that they might try to make another movie of this. If you like  Gothic movies than you will love this. A very bored and very entertaining Gothic Horror movie. More drama and romance than horror. This movie does has dip of horror. Just a little dip. The scary parts in the movie might be scary to only kids under 10. If you over ten it might not be scary to you. A great movie to see if you love Twilight. I think twilight fan is loving this movie. The screenwriting was dry but it was an average movie. Beginning is boring but it pick up after the beginning.

I guess there is no way I can use the rating system here when you have people admittedly saying the movie was just alright but not have anything really good to say about it, but then giving it a 9 or 10. This movie was a disaster and even though Amanda Seyfriend is in it, is not a good enough reason to rate it high. That is not a true review. She is a very limited range actress, and while has done a couple of good things, she really can't due dramatic roles with the depth they require. A really good actress can sometimes do something good with the character despite crappy writing and wierd animals flying around. I suppose it is young people who keep saying they like this crap and therefore will never get anything better..what a shame. Filmaking in the last decade has hit it's lowest point. The continual dumbing down of american youth. *sigh*.I'll stick to the older character and dialogue driven oldies. I don't need a lot of bells and whistles to keep my attention. I can have deep thoughts about a good plot and find entertainment in that, as always. I am so glad I was born in the 50's.

A pleasant movie and that surprised and impressed me greatly. Didn't expect it to be that good. At first I was interested by the proposal, and the trailer gave me even more enthusiasm to see this movie. I concluded deeply I was right about this movie. The people whose more criticize this film are filled with prejudice to the last strand of hair. Hardwicke made a bad movie? Yes, Twilight. But nobody can condemn it for life for this mistake and its consequences. Hardwicke went very well, created a tense atmosphere for a full history mysteries that bind you to the end of the film. Photography, scenery, beautiful costumes! Although the movie develops little information with some racing scenes in the early, plotâ
All I Can Say About Red Riding Hood Is Of Corse It Is Not Going To Win Any Awards.. But Overall This Is A Good, Fun Movie!

Bad editing, bad acting, bad directing, and bad writing all amounts to a waste of money. If you're looking for a good movie, you are definitely in the wrong place. It's a shame to think that a good plot would be ruined like this.

I really liked this movie.  I thought that Seyfried and Oldman were great.  But the 2 young guys I thought were kind of weird.  I really liked the atmosphere.  There was some point in the movie where it was getting tiresome, but it was pretty good.

Interesting score, but that is about it. With a very talented cast, that talent never shows itself, and this film nearly falls into B-movie status. It is just as corny as cornbread casserole! The whole thing is just odd, unrealistic, and choppy. Easily one of the worst films of the decade.

Sure, this isn't the deepest thought out movie but nevertheless entertaining enough. the pace of the movie is reasonably fast and doesn't give you too much time to think about the not-too-thick plot. Overall, its not a bad movie if you have you're looking to have a lazy evening at home. The visuals are good Amanda Seyfried fits into her role extremely well. Same can't be said of Gary Oldman though!

Twilight with a new skin. I am divided on if this is a movie or purposely insulting to the original story from Grimm. Same topic of being in love with a monster that should be eradicated if they ever appear. Same topic of a slut being the protagonist.

Red Riding Hood is an ok film. The wolf scenes in the film are pretty cool. My problems with this film is the fact the title is misleading. The Red Riding Hood I heard in my childhood was nowhere near what this movie was. I couldnt really care about the characters or who lived or die and the film is just boring. I would say see this film if you want but for me i wouldnt watch this.

The truth is, I wasn't really expecting much of this movie, but it definitely wasn't as bad as I expected. The story is really not that complicated, even though at certain points you're always wondering, who is who, what's going on, and so on. Very well made, probably the fact that it doesn't follow the story which we loved when we were children, made the public not appreciate this film. Great acting, small flaws in the movie, but in my opinion, a film worth seeing. Amanda, an impressive actress, couldn't have chosen a better role, followed by a strong male cast, and of course a mystery to mix them all up. Some elements really represent a sort of childish game, but all in all I would suggest you watch this movie. Not something you will remember in the past years, but still, if you're a fan of this kind of genre you won't be disappointed. I love movies and I liked this one. I really don't know what's the reason for all the small graded reviews, it was not at all that bad, that someone would rate it 0, for example, but I guess some people just don't appreciate the effort put in movies, even though you don't really argue with tastes. See it and rate it.

I wish I had checked out other reviews of this movie before watching it. Very average movie. I would probably encourage you to watch this once you have watched everything else you want to see. The acting is a bit average. The story not as engaging as it should have been. When you find out who the wolf is, its like, meh, ok.

What the hell ? They just ruined the classic fairy tale ! they wanted to made another twilight !!! Twilight sucks and this sucks 3 times more then that ! Only positive thing i found was the Village set ! but other then that nothing works...Nothing ! They ruined the classic story , To the Director "Never do one thing over and over again"  , Acting was so bad ! Amanda tried but failed and the director wanted to make 2 more "Edward" in this movie and guess what like Robert they should also take acting lessons . i had only hope in Gary Old-man but i think it was his worst acting job ever .

this is not a good movie, because the actors are not good and the only part of the film is the mystery that is easy to figure out who is the wolf, this movie only serve if you when there is nothing to do in your life
Only one thing was good in this film and his name is Gary Oldman, everything else is a crap, Amanda Seyfried must stop acting, every movie she does is a ****
generally ending matters in this types of moviez.....but here it is different & better

Catherine Hardwicke, the same director who directed the utterly terrible Twilight, takes a beloved children's fairy tale and mutilates it so that it becomes a tiresome and tedious medieval soap opera filled with talking werewolves. The acting is lackluster at best with Amanda Seyfried leading the pack of bad performances. The makeup design was horrible with the female and male actors all dolled up as if they had the luxury of twenty-first century cosmetics.  The score is nothing to brag about and the dim lighting used in all scenarios prohibited this film from becoming at all emotionally impactful. The only saving grace is the twist ending, which then soils itself with the defecation of the final ending.

Red Riding Hood is a 2011 horror film directed by Catherine Hardwicke. Valerie is a beautiful girl in love with Peter but his parents want him to marry Henry. Valerie and Peter are planning to run away but in the meantime Valerie's sister is killed by a werewolf. This will cause the arrival of his father Solomon, and will begin a monster hunt.

Grimm fairy tales have always been ripe for adaptation, but unfortunately, the people behind "Red Riding Hood" seemed to have overlooked this. http://spomposello.hubpages.com/hub/Movie-Review-Red-Riding-Hood-2011

I remember when I watch the trailer of Red Riding Hood, I think, a new twilight, but with other characters?, really?, after I watch the movie, and I say: This is a new Twilight version but with other characters, terrible, is ugly, a disaster. All this words be the better to describe Red Riding Hood. The cast is very regular, Amanda Seyfried not is a great actress, but have her moments, but in Riding Hood, no, is horrible, with a same face of Stewart on Twilight, and the rest of the cast, really? have a horrible performances, and do a boring movie. Now the screenplay, have good intentions, but really? the father is the wolf? what happen?, is a terrible idea. Now do this classic tale like a horror film, or poor intent or horror movie is bad. I think that the movie have some good (but no excellent effects), the screenplay terrible, horrible performances, and the final do of Red Riding Hood one of the worst films of the last year.

So this is what you get when you insert the Twilight characters into a children's fairy tale. "Red Riding Hood" is a wannabe horror movie starring dumb and lifeless teenagers who are tremendously drunk with hormones. Alcohol may produce better behaviors.

One of the worst films that i have seen on the last year. It's like a Twilight version for red riding hood, terrible. Please tell to the director that lycanthropes are people that transform into normal wolves, werewolves are MONSTERS.

An alright movie that really isn't anything special. It is really unclear why Gary Oldman gets top billing as he is barely in the movie. However it does take an interesting approach to this story. So I will give it a partially positive review just for trying to be something new. Overall: OK movie, but you're really not missing much.

While the concept might seem a little corny being based on a kids nursery rhyme this was actually a pretty decent film. Slow to get going but once it does it manages to hold your attention and keep you guessing as to who the identity of the wolf it (and I love those whodunnit movies). Amanda Seyfried is gorgeous as always and plays the role of young Valerie very well, but in general the cast is just average. Overall it's worth a look and not as bad as its made out to be by the critics!
I think a fun way to play a classic tale. amanda seyfried makes an incredible interpretation. the only flaw is perhaps that it is a bit slow. I personally like dark stories.
The film creates a creepy atmosphere and has great cinematography/ action sequences  but the acting is trash along with the cliched uninspired story and script.
Gary Oldman is the one bright light in this tired drama that deserves neither his talent or your time.
This movie is one of the best movies I have ever seen because of its plot twists
